entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a character who is observing the stream of smoke without surprise. He is also shown to be interacting with an instrument and giving it gentle taps with his wand.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as a character who is wondering whether the instrument was confirming his story and looking eagerly at Dumbledore for a sign that he was right.

entities.name: instrument
entities.description: The instrument is described as being played by Dumbledore and producing smoke serpents. It is also mentioned as being tapped with a wand to slow down the clinking noise.

entities.name: smoke serpent
entities.description: Smoke serpents are produced by the instrument and split into two snakes when Dumbledore asks if they are divided. They grow faint and vanish after being tapped with a wand.

entities.name: stream of smoke
entities.description: The stream of smoke is mentioned as being observed by Dumbledore without surprise. It produces smoke serpents when the instrument is played.

relationships.description: Dumbledore interacts with the instrument, playing it and giving it gentle taps with his wand to produce smoke serpents.
Harry observes Dumbledore interacting with the instrument and producing smoke serpents.
The instrument produces smoke serpents when played by Dumbledore.
Dumbledore manipulates the smoke serpents, tapping them with his wand to slow down the clinking noise and make them grow faint and vanish.
Dumbledore is followed by old headmasters in portraits with their eyes, then they realize Harry is watching them and hastily look away.
